ultirai

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • ultirai.Board

  • public final class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    An immutable class that represents a square-shaped tic-tac-toe board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int size)
      Creates a new Board that is clear at start.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

      Returns the Mark value in the position (x,y).
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the board, that is the length of its either dimension.
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isFilled() 
      Board next(Mark mark, int x, int y)
      Creates and returns the next state of the board, where the value indicated with x and y is replaced with mark.
      Mark resolve()
      Attempts to resolve the value (or winner) of the board by checking all suitable rows for streaks of the same Mark.
      char[][] toCharArray(char cross, char nought, char none)
      Creates and returns the char array representation of the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int size)
        Creates a new Board that is clear at start. The size argument must be positive.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the board

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public Board next(Mark mark,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Creates and returns the next state of the board, where the value indicated with x and y is replaced with mark. Both x and y must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the board (exclusive).

        Only required references will be changed for the new object. In other words the board returned will retain all same references to unchanged rows and columns. This makes the function to perform in O(n) time.

        Parameters:
        mark - the new value of Mark indicated by x and y in returned board
        x - position index in the horizontal dimension for mark
        y - position index in the vertical dimension for mark
        Returns:
        Board object where the value in position indicated by x and y is mark

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the board, that is the length of its either dimension.
        Returns:
        the size of the board

      • getMarkAt

        public Mark getMarkAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Returns the Mark value in the position (x,y). Both arguments need to be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the board (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        x - index of the horizontal dimension
        y - index of the vertical dimension
        Returns:
        Mark in the given position

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled()
        Returns:
        true if the grid is filled with CROSS and NOUGHT

      • toCharArray

        public char[][] toCharArray(char cross,
                            char nought,
                            char none)
        Creates and returns the char array representation of the board. The board returned will not be maintained by this object so it can be manipulated as required.
        Parameters:
        cross - representation of cross in returned array
        nought - representation of nought in returned array
        none - representation of an empty position
        Returns:
        2D char array with the same dimensions as the board

      • resolve

        public Mark resolve()
        Attempts to resolve the value (or winner) of the board by checking all suitable rows for streaks of the same Mark.
        Returns:
        the value of the board

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
